list.item: School closes sooner than planned with program.

p.del: Dearest Family: A long letter from Jane Monday and another yesterday (Wednesday) so feel quite pleased and especially glad to hear about the skirt - Bessie is a dear to do it & hope she remembers that I've gained about 15 lbs! Such a sadness comes over my spirits when I stand before a mirror or put on my blue crepe dechine or that little gray wash dress - in fact everything fits very snugly except my sweater & that fortunately can expand even as I do - It will take at least a week

for the package to come through so perhaps you better mail it to Mrs. E. A. Helmick - 3750 Oliver St. N. W. Wash. D.C. That is if it won't have plenty of time to get here by Apr 3 - (Sat.) for I expect to leave Monday morning Apr 5 - before the mail gets in - But these directions are no doubt useless for perhaps by this time the skirt is on its way - It is perfectly lovely of you Jane to make me a present of it & I will accept it & hope to get even with you soon. Am glad I did not get it last year for now it will be nice

and fresh & anyway would have been too tight. Am glad pa is so well & that you have both enjoyed your work. Hope my Sunday letter will stir you up to coming east. As to money I have about two hundred dollars which I hope will suffice until after the D.A.R. - If not will write to you for the loan of some but hope it won't be necessary -

div1.p:
It is a wonderful morning & here I am writing you peacefully in my room - Don't you wonder why I'm not at school? Well school closed yesterday for like you we have smallpox in our midst - Last Saturday it was rumored that Ephraim Ogle (Charlie's father) had it but you know doctors are not always certain about the disease - sometimes getting it confused with measles - so we just wondered about it & went along as usual - People went to see him - Charlie kept the store open until Monday night when he closed it & it was known for certain that smallpox was the disease - So many have been exposed that we wondered about going on with school & finally decided to do so. Then Dr. Massy came up yesterday a.m. & thought we ought to close and not give the exercises to a crowd as
we had planned - He thinks that smallpox may have been in the soldiers clothes that have been sold here. So at noon yesterday was great excitement - We decided to go through the program just by ourselves & get together our stage properties etc. Decorated a little & by 2 the thing was in full swing - no guests of course - Had school magazine - songs by Emily's primary class - Mother Goose Play by Abbie's - my Japanese lantern drill & then the play - Bunch of Roses - It went off well & we were pleased & so were the youngsters tho
at first peeved - Emily & Mr. C. left about four & Abby went down with Dr. Massy last night - So Evelyn & I are left with Mrs. P. & Aunt L. - a Pi Phi Miss Turnbull visited us arriving Tuesday noon and leaving after dinner today. Since I began this have taken a walk with her up to Tom Camel''s - Last night we went up Baskin's - She thinks everything very picturesque & was quite appalled with the inside of the Camel house - the way they live - their daughter etc.

Monday we all went over to the hotel where we had a wond-
erfully grand dinner - chicken lemon pie etc. Mrs. Huff was there too. As to the smallpox Dr. M. said it was perfectly all right for me to stay here a week - I wondered if we would all be quarantined - He said he'd see that I got out all right if that were done. The days will just fly by I'm sure - am going to make some combinations mend - pack - visit -

Friday a.m. Am so sorry I didn't get the chance to send this off by yesterday's mail. The newspapers came yesterday & the clippings which were very interesting - Some of the churches are beginning to realize that healing today should be as possible as in the times of the writings of the the Old & New Testament. As long as my movements seem so uncertain think I'll have my Science literature sent home until I get settled in my mind just where I will be - Felt just like giving up everything when Emily left Wednesday - Do you wonder?

A terrible wind & rainstorm descended on us last night but it is "brite & fair" this a.m. Evelyn leaves this p.m. Everyone is beginning to work outside in the fields now getting the ground ready for crops -
Wonder isfthe smallpox excitement with you has subsided? I know you do not think much of vaccination but am going to send you this clipping anyway.
